What should you do?

discussion.content: The statement says: "If a customer's credit and reference review is unfavorable, the finance manager must follow up with the customer and the sales representative by phone". I would think the answer is to create an activity.

comments.content: yes, but not a "custom" activity. You should create the new status reason and, when necesary, create a phone call activity as follow up.

What should you create?

choices.D: new data step in the business process flow

discussion.content: This is in contrary with previous question, for which answer should be add status reason. Now the answer for credit checks is custom activity.

Selected Answer: C
A custom activity can provide start date & end date, a time-study can build on this.

comments.content: I don't see how data step can help to track time. C is probably the best option here
Yes, custom activity can provide start date & end date, which we can calcuate the time spend on the process.

discussion.content: I think that the first answer is. Modify Cloase opportunity option set, because opportunity Status option set fieldas are: In Progress and On-Hold. The second answer is correct.

comments.content: No Opp Status values are Open/Won/Lost. Opp Status Reason is In Progress/On Hold (on Opp form, the Status Reason field is labelled Status - very confusing)

I am thinking the same idea too. The Opportunity Status must be Lost, I don't think we should change that. Instead, we can modify / add more status reason. The current status reason for Lost is Canceled / Out-Sold

discussion.content: I think first answer is "Modify Status Reason" as Status Reason field is always used to give further detail to the Status field. It's not "Opportunity Status", those values are for overall status; it's not "Close Opportunity optionset", as that isn't a field (that answer seems to be broadly referring to the Status Reason field on Opportunity Close entity)

discussion.content: My thoughts on this: first question should be A. If you have an opportunity for multiple products to be sold over different countries you must have multiple price lists one for each country. Then it is healthy to have one quote for each country so you can associate the quote with the relative price list of that country. I don't see how you can achieve this with one single quote for a single opportunity.

comments.content: I think the given answer of B is ok, as it seems they are generating quotes from opportunities; they could either create an opp for each country for CustomerB and then the quote; or create one opp for CustomerB (add pricelist for the country, add product, change pricelist for next country, add product) and then a quote. Either way, the quote is coming off of the opp
Why is 3 C? Answer does not seem to match the question

discussion.content: Please can someone explain the answer?

comments.content:
For 1, I think it is A, because the shipping location will be one and only. It is better to create for different countries, so that we can help the business flow.
For 2, it is B, because the price / discotinued product will not update until you make changes of the quote.
For 3, it is A because it needs for Canadian plant, it suppose to use the price list of Canada. The step should be "Revise" quote, change the currency, then change the price list, delete the old product item. By changing the currency itself, cannot help the whole process. So I would say A is more suitable for the whole process.
